intro: Gnaphalium candidissimum, commonly known as white cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense heads. The plant has a low-growing habit with slender, hairy stems and alternate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Gnaphalium candidissimum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many temperate regions.
